required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Clinical and Radiographic Outcomes of a 3D-printed Patient-specific Biomimetic Bone Substitute in Maxillofacial Indications: an Interventional, Multi-centred, Open-label, Post-market Clinical Investigation.
clinical_study.official_title: The Clinical and Radiographic Outcomes of a 3D-printed Patient-specific Biomimetic Bone Substitute in Maxillofacial Indications: an Interventional, Multi-centred, Open-label, Post-market Clinical Investigation.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the clinical and radiographic outcome of MimetikOss 3D as a patient-specific bone substitute in regeneration of osseous defects in several maxillofacial indications. The primary objective is to evaluate the capacity of MimetikOss 3D to perform bone substitute requirements, i.e long-term regeneration of bony tissue in complex defects without detrimental resorption. The secondary main objectives are to assess the versatility of MimetikOss 3D by the variety of maxillofacial sites regenerated and the surgical technique improvement (in terms of surgery duration, blood loss, ease-of-use of the product and surgeon satisfaction).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Since the studied medical device is a custom-made product, only one group is considered.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric evolution of the grafted volume through radiological evaluation

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric evolution of the grafted volume through radiological evaluation
Versatility of MimetikOss 3D patient-specific bone substitute
secondary_outcome.description: MimetikOss 3D can be implanted to regenerate osseous defect from different indications of the maxillofacial area (dental area, jaw and maxilla reconstruction, zygomatic reconstruction and/or chin reconstruction for instance).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of serious adverse events and adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the surgery / 6 months post-surgery / 12 months post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgical technique improvement in terms of accuracy of MimetikOss 3D design and positioning
secondary_outcome.time_frame: directly after the surgery / 6 months post-surgery / 12 months post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgical technique improvement in terms of total surgery duration and duration of implantation of MimetikOss 3D
Surgical technique improvement in terms of blood loss measurement
Surgical technique improvement in terms of surgeon satisfaction
Aesthetic evaluation by visual observation of the symmetry of the face, pictures and/or irregular contours prosthetic palpable (if applicable)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: directly after the surgery / 6 months post-surgery / 12 months post-surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Surgical reconstruction of maxillofacial osseous defect with MimetikOss 3D.
intervention.description: Surgical reconstruction of maxillofacial osseous defect with MimetikOss 3D.

overall_official.last_name: Òscar Escuder i de la Torre
